Initially i wanted to make a pure CoT build but at the end i gave in and made this Knight of pure win. Ftr/Paladins/CoT can be boring to play sometimes, so i made sure he has all the toys available in his arsenal and that's Devastating Critical included, because he is not a soft one. He will Taunt, he will smite, he will let loose his Wrath to Devastating effects while he is protected by divine radiance and his otherworldly saves. Other incarnations of him may roam the old ECB but they either have very low AB or they are one trick-ponies smite/wrath variations.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
The +13 on saves from those CoT levels and the +5 from Spellcraft count towards the +20 cap on saves boosts. Divine Grace from Paladin does not. I just checked the NWNWiki, and Divine Wrath also counts toward the +20 cap, which puts you over the cap, so some of it is wasted.

For this reason, how about taking those 16 levels of CoT above 10 and making 8 of them Fighter, for the same total number of feats, and making the other 8 Paladin, for more Paladin goodies? That would make it Paladin 16 / Fighter 14 / CoT 10.

posts.author: Demos
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote:The +13 on saves from those CoT levels and the +5 from Spellcraft count towards the +20 cap on saves boosts. Divine Grace from Paladin does not. I just checked the NWNWiki, and Divine Wrath also counts toward the +20 cap, which puts you over the cap, so some of it is wasted.

For this reason, how about taking those 16 levels of CoT above 10 and making 8 of them Fighter, for the same total number of feats, and making the other 8 Paladin, for more Paladin goodies? That would make it Paladin 16 / Fighter 14 / CoT 10.
I like that line of thought Empyre but the big issue is the toon has a WIS of 8 so those extra paladin goodies, mainly spells, are wasted. I like a minimum of 15 Paladin levels myself to max out Divine Favor but that's not possible in this case and would be a completely different kind of build.

I don't have time to research but what's the most level of COT could he take before hitting the cap? Move the remaining over to Fighter and keep the Paladin levels the same.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Some nice ideas here Empyre, you are right that both spellcraft & the CoT bonuses count for the +20 limit and that is why i put Spot there instead and left spellcraft as a secondary choice for those that are fanatical with saves. But it is as Demos said, i would hate to loose the Paladin spells so i would have to begin with all 14's except DEX naturally, and that would drop my final attributes to about 26 STr & 18 CHa, so i would lose some steam from all those divine feats he has & his final saves would be much lower due to the lack of those 16 lvls of CoT.

Still a fine suggestion but that would be best in a new build made with those things in mind from the start. Thanks for the input.
